column4: any takers on why the installer would fail when trying to install the kernel.
*nod* that's what i was thinking. though i just burned it today. :(
nope. should have though. but i did run a check on the cd from within the installer.
then it should be ok, is the installer still up on your screen?
one of the virtual terminals shows debugging output try Ctrl+Alt+F1-4
you might try restarting the install, if it fails again, check the md5 and reburn possilby at a lower speed
do you know off the top of your head where this installs to? might have made a partition too small (old machine small disk)
how big did you make boot?
yeah, its too small. i think that's the problem
